The couple were married on Saturday afternoon at the National Arts Club in New York.
Suji Kwock Kim and Raymond Collier Short were married yesterday afternoon at the National Arts Club in New York. The Rev. Verity A. Jones, a minister of the Disciples of Christ, officiated.
The bride and bridegroom met as freshmen at Yale, from which they graduated, he cum laude. They became reacquainted at their 15th college reunion and began dating shortly thereafter.

Ms. Kim, 38, is keeping her name. She is a poet and a winner of the 2006 Whiting Writing Award for emerging writers. She wrote ''Notes From the Divided Country: Poems'' (Louisiana State University Press, 2003), which was the winner of the 2002 Walt Whitman Award from the Academy of American Poets. She received a Master of Fine Arts in creative writing from the University of Iowa and, in 1998 and 1999, studied Korean as a Fulbright fellow at Yonsei University and Seoul National University.
She is a daughter of Sunja Kwock and Dr. William Kwock of Milton, N.Y. The bride uses her mother's maiden name.
Mr. Short, 40, works in Union, N.J., as a manager of the marketing unit of Carlson, the Minneapolis hotel, restaurant and travel services company; he is responsible for business development.
He is the son of the late Frances Short and Bryan C. Short of Flagstaff, Ariz.
